summary: This is an FBI Daily News Briefing email from July 26, 2023, summarizing news articles of interest to the FBI. It covers a wide range of topics including criminal investigations, counterterrorism, counterintelligence, and other FBI news. Notably, it includes a brief item about an Epstein victim suing the FBI for ignoring her claims for 10 years.

persons.name: Maria Farmer
persons.context: She is suing the FBI for ignoring her case for a decade after she reported being kidnapped and assaulted by Epstein in 1996.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.context: She is the attorney for Maria Farmer in the lawsuit against the FBI.

persons.name: Jim Jordan
persons.context: He is mentioned in multiple news items, including advocating for the FBI to move its headquarters to Huntsville and threatening to hold Director Wray in contempt over document requests.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of providing documents to the House Judiciary Committee under threat of contempt and defending FISA Section 702.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator whose victim, Maria Farmer, is suing the FBI for failing to investigate her claims.

connections.description: Farmer was a victim of Epstein, reporting being kidnapped and assaulted by him in 1996.
Freeman is the attorney representing Farmer in her lawsuit against the FBI.
Jordan, as House Judiciary Chairman, is pressuring and investigating the FBI under Director Wray, threatening contempt over document production.

events.title: Maria Farmer reports Epstein to FBI
events.description: Maria Farmer, while working for Jeffrey Epstein, reported to the NYPD and then the FBI that she had been kidnapped and assaulted by Epstein.

events.title: Epstein victim sues FBI
events.description: Maria Farmer, with attorney Jennifer Freeman, is in the process of filing a notice of claim against the FBI for ignoring her case against Jeffrey Epstein for a decade.

keyFacts: Maria Farmer, a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, is suing the FBI for ignoring her claims for 10 years after she reported being kidnapped and assaulted by Epstein in 1996.
The lawsuit is in the process of having a notice of claim (a legal precursor) filed with the FBI.
The document is an FBI Daily News Briefing, showing the FBI internally circulating news about a lawsuit against itself regarding the Epstein case.
House Judiciary Chairman Jim Jordan is advocating for relocating the FBI headquarters from Washington D.C. to Huntsville, Alabama, as part of efforts to 'reign in FBI abuses.'
The briefing covers numerous other news stories unrelated to Epstein, indicating the Farmer lawsuit was one of many items of interest to the FBI that day.
